chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:19 PM Defendant Austin Edward Manthey in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Austin Edward Manthey.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 2022TR000228, 2022TR000229, 2022TR000230, 2022TR000231, 2022TR000232, 2022TR000233, 2022TR000234, 2022TR000235 tracking with 22CF24:
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Juech files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Gumz and the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading. Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 

Atty Gumz asks to modify the bond to a $5,000 cash bond.  Atty Burdon objects to the modification of the cash bond.
BY THE COURT:  Motion to modify the cash bond is denied

Atty Gumz makes additional argument on the bond modification request.
T.W. answers questions by the court.
Atty Burdon objects and makes arguments.
BY THE COURT:  Court grants the motion to modify the cash bond to a $5,000 cash bond with conditions:
Defendant is to reside with his mother in her residence
Status hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
